Our expedia.com .au booking included buffet breakfast for all 3 of us and when I went to enquire about how this would work or do I need a voucher I was told by the "snippy" female manager that they would not be honouring the breakfasts and that was that! I felt cheated as had paid 150/night for 1 room with 2 beds and with breakfast for all of us was a good deal without an overpriced hotel in a dead part of downtown(rooms were dated but very nice though).I felt cheated and resented her matter of fact attitude so rang expedia who were WONDERFUL!!!!! and totally professional.A lovely girl named Katie emphathised with me and rang this manager offering for expedia to pay for our breakfasts(3 of them) as our voucher had 3 listings and no of breakfasts were not specified.About 1 1/2 hours later and several phone calls to the office some vouchers were slid under the door.Only 2 of them. I re rang this evening femail manager who argued that only 2 breakfasts were on the booking(that they weren't going to honour) I said expedia have offered to pay for 3 and that's what I should have. She replied rather angrily that "I can ring expedia it won't change a thing!"I rang expedia.com.au.Spoke to Katie again.She recontacted the hotel and another voucher was delivered 30 mins later.Anyone would think this woman was paying for us personally!!!! I guess I didn't understand why she was so difficult when expedia were footing the bill for this and they were lovely to deal with. Spoilt my impression of this hotel as (one rude staff member can do) which was a shame as the manager was lovely to deal with

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ademarco6
Reviews.Content: We booked for one night so that we could see Lady Gaga perform at the Nokia Center. I googled the nearest hotel to the Nokia Center and it showed Hilton Checkers and so I booked a room. The hotel only has valet parking and it was difficult to find a place to try to get it valeted since it is such a small area and is always congested with cars. We kept having to drive around on the one way streets to find space to have them valet the car. After dropping the car off the reception was nice and gave us our room keys and breakfast vouchers. The doorman were nice and brought our bags upstairs and we tipped them. We asked for advice on where to eat and ate at the best sushi restaurant in the world. I forgot the name (Mitaki or something), a few blocks away and very inexpensive compared to the quality and quantity of food. I've had sushi in Hawaii and this place blew it away. We walked to the concert and noticed that a Holiday Inn was located right across the street from the Nokia Center and that was where we had to pickup the tickets for the concert. So from now on we will probably try and book a room there and check it out. Walking back to the Hilton Checkers at night was kind of sketchy as they have a large homeless population that moves about at night, but we made it back with no problems. The hotel is actually right beside the LA Library. I swore that was the largest library that I've ever been too. I thought it was a museum and it was very interesting to walk around and visit. The Hilton hotel had free wi-fi and coffee samples and the bed was decent. It had a roof top pool and fitness gym. The gym had free fruit baskets. The breakfast in the morning was decent and the coffee was great. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: businesstravel777
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - excellent food, service, and room. Better than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: UncleGus32
Reviews.Content: This quaint boutique hotel is in the heart of downtown LA, and is within "reasonable" walking distance of the theatre district, lots of restaurants and bars, and just minutes by cab to the Staples Center. While the rooms are a little on the small side (which you expect from a building that is over 80 years old), they certainly aren't tiny either. The rooms are modern, clean and well appointed with a good size granite top desk, comfortable bed, and large flat panel TV. Lots of closet space, and the bathroom was surprisingly large. The hotel itself is very charming with an elegant decor. And while there are a lot of great restaurants in the downtown area, the Checker's restaurant in the hotel is also very good. And be sure to go up to the rooftop pool area for some spectacular views of the skyline. The staff are great too. Everyone was extremely friendly and professional from the doorman to front desk, and in the restaurant and bar. If you need to stay in downtown LA you can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Core of Dowtown LA”
Reviews.Author: Historiana
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel right in downtown LA and this offered a very fair rate. It was a first class hotel with very good service and right across the street from the Biltmore. It has a nice bar and restaurant and is just a couple of blocks from the starting point for many of the LA Conservancy walking tours. That said, the area is a bit “iffy” at night with unfortunately a large number of homeless people in downtown. However, if you have business downtown or want to explore what was LA, this is a solid choice. If you do stay downtown, it is worth going over to “The Edison” for a drink and snack where they party like it was 1929!

Reviews.Title: “Simply ....... Wow !”
Reviews.Author: Briansa
Reviews.Content: We're from Minnesota and have never traveled to L.A. before. We won this trip for a concert at the Staples Center. The hotel was wonderful, L.A. exceeded all expectations we had of a large downtown area. I work in downtown St. Paul, MN and I have to tell you, this 6 - 8 block square area was unbelievable clean and beautiful. We were able to walk everywhere, the Staples Center, the Metro subway to Hollywood, all the coffee and restaurants... it was all just a short walk away. The hotel was beautiful with it's rooftop penthouse with spa, swimming pool, hot tub, sitting areas was so unbelievable with the views of the tall buildings downtown. We sat there from late afternoon sun to nightime just amazed at the view. They had a drink special on Thursday evenings that was a good deal and we were able to walk out of the bar with our drinks and head to the roof. What a treat. The hotel is so quiet, not sure if it's due to the older construction? We were on the 5th floor and RARELY heard anyone above or on the same floor. Thanks Hilton Checkers Los Angeles !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Great Service in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravelers
Reviews.Content: We took the train up to LA for one night from San Diego to see Will Ferrell at the Nokia. We booked this hotel on points to stay for one night. From Union Station, we jumped on the Metro purple line (red will get you there also) and got off at Pershing Square and walked to the hotel. We arrived and checked in about 3pm and our room was ready, room 1106. The rooms are a little small, but they were nice, clean, and comfortable. The place had a romantic feel. We ended up ordering a fruit plate and got chocolate covered strawberries extra! The bathroom is a good size and the shower had a dual shower head! After getting settled, we went to check out the spa level with the pool and hot tub. The pool is pretty small, but the view is really cool. We were hoping to use the hot tub, but didn't end up having time. There is also a small workout room up there with a couple of treadmills and some weights. We had a fun, great dinner at Yojie and walked there, straight down Grand Ave about 4 or 5 blocks, before the show. We would have continued walking to the Nokia after dinner, but I forgot the tickets. We walked back to the hotel and took a cab (about $10) to Nokia. We walked back to the hotel after the show and it took about 20 minutes. We felt completely safe the entire time. We had breakfast the next morning in the restaurant. I had the pancakes with pecans and cinnamon pecan butter. The hubby had the huevos rancheros. Both items were very good. The service was pretty good although I saw only 2 people running the whole place for breakfast. We had never been to downtown LA before and found downtown to be fairly clean and quiet (most people stay in Hollywood or the beaches). When we left on Sunday, we walked to the train station (about 30 minutes) to do a little sight seeing on the way. It was crazy that it was so quiet and deserted! OVERALL, we really like this hotel and had an enjoyable stay. We will definitely look into staying here again if we decide to go to another show or game at Staples in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Central Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: Realpeeps
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Checkers. Rooms are nice but small. Decent size bathroom, Nice flat screen tv. Had a king size bed, which was very comfortable. Walls were thin, Location is central downtown so you can walk anywhere (Disney Hall, Little Tokyo, museums, Macy Plaza.) My husband and I took a 15 minute walk over to Nokia theatre for a concert. There's lots of eateries, bowling, Conga Room, Staples Center next to the Nokia, so lots to do. The Hotel has a nice rooftop pool and spa, although they decided to drain the hot tub. Probably not a good idea to drain the hot tub on Valentine's Day weekend when the hotel is busy. We ate dinner at the hotel's restaurant. Food was okay and portions very small and because it was Valentine's night, there was a pre-fixed menu of 4 courses for $75. A little pricey. A few of our cons were: Draining the hot tub and Ice Cold pool Employees were unfamiliar with what the Valentine's day package included. Missing bottle of champagne as part of our package. Had to wait until next morning to get it. No robes in room. (Boutique hotel???) We have to thank Dorris at the front desk. When we expressed our dissatisfaction, She took action to remedy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good area.”
Reviews.Author: BOOBOO30
Reviews.Content: We booked this based on the location reviews and were not disappointed. There is valet parking which was rather expensive but nice and easy. There is overnight parking in Pershing Square at a fraction of the price. The check in was quick and courteous and the room was easy to find. It was rather nice not to have people jump on you trying to carry your bags to the room, but if you do want help it is available. The room was a reasonable size and was very clean with nice bedding, towels and toiletries. We were knackered on arrival so ate room service which was very tasty and there was plenty of it. The next night we ate in the restaurant which I would suggest you don't bother with. Had we not been so very very jet lagged we would have gone out, but we just couldn't make it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly, great location”
Reviews.Author: craiginnycNewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times and I always enjoy it. The staff is very friendly, and everyone from the bellmen to the front desk staff all greet everyone each time they enter. I stay there because my client is close by. I have stayed in other properties nearby, but this is my favorite. It's lovely, low-key, friendly, and very comfortable. I generally stay on the top floor and have had fantastic views of the gorgeous roof of the public library and Library Tower. I only wish the rates were more competitive with the other nearby properties. It's tricky to justify to my client.

Reviews.Title: “great manhattan-style hotel in downtown”
Reviews.Author: plasticintruder
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my brief stay at the Hilton Checkers, an early 20th-century building wedged between the skyscrapers in the heart of downtown. The hotel is right next to the public library and Library (USBank) Tower. Even my 2nd floor room had a pretty good view of it and the surrounding buildings, if only while standing at the window. The size of the room was as you would expect for a building of this age, but the space was used well and the marble bathroom and closet were surprisingly large. Most rooms have corner windows for added light. Other nice touches such as back-lit headboards, decorative glass sconces, crown molding, and granite topped furniture make this a much nicer Hilton property than many others. The roof-level pool area is amazing. Trendy restaurants, convenience stores, public transit, and self parking are all less than 2 blocks away. The hotel only offers valet parking for 38.50 but lots nearby charge 12-18 for overnight parking (not secured). Best in-room coffee I've ever had (Lavazza). I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: coconutdani
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Checkers to be close to staples centre, it was a 3 minute cab ride and cost $5.00. The door guys at this hotel are awesome, if you stay there, chat up Christopher, he was great. The breakfast was super nice, but I swear the wife's from "real wives of OC" were dining there too....lol... Only down side to the room was that we had an excellent view of the air equipment on the roof of the building next to us. Other than that, No Complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in good location in downtown LA.”
Reviews.Author: annieb37
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hilton Checkers in downtown LA for 2 nights for business trip. Staff were friendly enough. My room was of a good size and bed and pillows really comfortable. Loved the bathroom, they supplied plenty of cotton buds which came in handy for makeup etc. Towels really soft but wasn't so keen on the soap for showering as I usually use shower gel. Room was nice and quiet. Although they had snacks and beverages in the room there was no refrigerator / cooler which was a bit of a pain as I like to have chilled water. Had fresh granola with yoghurt and fresh fruits for breakfast which was ok. Fruit was nice but rest tasted a bit bland. Used the computers for emailing etc and speed was pretty fast. Gym on top floor was okay size and had 3 treadmills. All in all a pleasant hotel and fairly good location for downtown LA.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and functional”
Reviews.Author: sehr-wichtig
Reviews.Content: In general my experience is better than many reviews I have read about this hotel. I want to mention cleanliness, friendliness of reception staff and reliability of housekeeping. The restaurant ist very good. Someone lookimg for drawbacks? Here they are: Internet too slow. Spa needs refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “The price is right; you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: NorCalHereAndThere
Reviews.Content: When traveling to LA, I usually stay at the Biltmore across the street. This time I thought I would give the Checkers a try--see what a small hotel can offer. Besides, it was cheaper than the Biltmore. The place is centrally located. The front desk staff was friendly. The room was clean. The room service prompt. Unfortunately, the squeaky girls next door made me feel like I was in a dorm room. The neighbors on the other side started to watch tv at an early hour. The place had thin walls. The other problem was the bar. I came in late, after 11 pm, so maybe the place was closed. But there was a bartender and one gabby patron sitting at one end, so I took up a stool. The bartender never even looked in my direction. She could not have been enthralled by the gabby middle aged guy at the bar. Not worth it--really. After several minutes and no sign that she was aware of my existence, I left. Bad! (The bar at the Biltmore--much better. It was raining so I decided not to venture across the street and went up to the noisy room instead.) The other disappointment was the spa. They advertise in-room hair and makeup services and I thought I would treat myself before my work-related event. I called about 4 days before my arrival but they were booked and I was out of luck. Sigh. So, the place is ok. If the Biltmore is booked or I need to economize, I might try it again.

Reviews.Title: “I love Checkers!”
Reviews.Author: W.R.F.
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on Thanksgiving weekend with our grandkids, everyone loves this place. At last- a hotel where we can open the windows and get fresh air! It's intimate, nicely designed, and the marble bathrooms feel like a hotel in Europe. All the employees are very nice, and they give Hilton Honors members free full American style breakfasts in their lovely restaurant, which are REALLY good. The lobby is very nice for being compact; had a nice chess set where we sat and played chess for several hours. And it IS walking distance to everything in Downtown L.A.--and right up the street from our favorite restaurant Bottega Louie. Thank you Checkers, for making our stay so wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Pack lightly!”
Reviews.Author: pharmertoo
Reviews.Content: Smallest room of any Hilton I've ever seen. Not enough room to roll our suitcase between bed and dresser. Nice large flat screen TV, but so close to bed that gave me headache.

Reviews.Title: “"We were overbooked . . ." or "Don't get too comfortable at the bar just yet, sir."”
Reviews.Author: EastBayTraveler
Reviews.Content: Arrived after midnight to be told no room, due to hotel being overbooked. News to me. News to my firm's travel department. Options were a Radisson three miles away or some place in Montebello (!). Ultimately got a room, on their nickel, at Beverly Hilton. Almost $100 in cab fare to that hotel and back to downtown the next day. And this from a preferred hotel for my firm. So be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and intimate nice rooms but expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: phdtravel
Reviews.Content: Elegant rooms a cut above the usual Hilton. Good big beds and quiet rooms. Nice breakfast room and elegant townhouse Continental style. Pool is tiny. Location not great. Its not walking distance to the music center / Disney hall / staples and there is no shuttle. Be nice if there were so you won't have parking hassles. The hotel parking is very expensive. Nearly 40 bucks. So even if you get a good rate the parking wipes that out. If they cut down parking charges this hotel would be an excellent downtown choice. Not a lot of dining choices nearby mainly other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “pleasing”
Reviews.Author: travelmaniac77
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay at this particular hilton hotel. The customer service with good and people who work there were very helpful and nice. I do like it how they have free parking and it was very convenient for me to transport my luggages to my hotel room. The room that I stayed in was nice and cozy. Overall, I was satisfy with my stay here at the Hilton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Downtown Choice”
Reviews.Author: tvprodny
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 3 day stay at The Hilton Checkers. It is a smaller hotel and we preferred that to a much bigger hotel like the Westin Bonaventure. For downtown I think it is a good choice. The room was average size with contemporary furnishings and a comfortable bed. Fine, but not spectacular. The hotel was kept very, very clean with the exception of room service dishes down the hall that were not picked up in a timely fashion (two days in a row) and bothered me enough to comment to the front desk about (they were picked up soon after). Highlights were the roof deck pool and hot tub. While small, it was nice to have a swim and sit and look at the skyline. At times we had it to ourselves. We did not eat at in the in house restaurant but colleagues did not like their lunch there and we heard room service was "not great". However, our group had a small party on the back patio and we all felt the food was excellent and a nice atmospehere was created with light strings and dressed tables despite the narrow space. Biggest downsides: Bar charged outrageous prices for a glass of house wine...I think it was $17. Renovation was ocurring off the front lobby that was somewhat disruptful at times. Room service dishes not picked up for hours. Pluses: Smaller hotel, nice but small rooftop pool and hot tub. Close to the LA Library (worth a visit), Disney Music Hall, and other downtown venues. It is across from the Millenium Biltmore (we did not stay there because we heard the rooms/bathrooms were small) but we enjoyed walking through the ornate lobby and having breakfast there, and taking a look at the historic photography.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mcgavock2
Reviews.Content: Very Clean, enjoyable. Nicely located to restaurants, starbucks, city center.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: olig
Reviews.Content: I was expecting something more that I got. The hotel does feel a bit European & the small roof top pool has really cool views. I was underwhelmed by the indifferent service at reception. The bedroom and bathroom were small too, bit claustrophobic. The bathroom felt tired. Restaurant was OK - few raves about it on this site. Frankly, I don't know what all the fuss was about. Nothing to write home about in my humble opinion. May be I am just a bit picky and harder to please. Handy for downtown LA. Wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LBiship
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June and found it very nice. We had a corner room with double windows which was very great. The windows opened which I love in a hotel and as the weather was wonderful it was very refreshing. The room was very clean, the beds comfortable. Nice flatscreen TVs. The staff was very friendly always speaking to you as you came and left the buliding. There is a Starbucks close by as well as numerous other food shops. Valet parking is about the average for city hotels however the valet staff was very good and quick to bring your car when requested. The rooftop pool was very small but the view was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very clean!”
Reviews.Author: shudonz
Reviews.Content: If you are working downtown this is a really nice place to stay. I have stayed in nicer hotels, but this has to be the cleanest hotel I have ever set foot in. The staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Seasons greetings at the checkers!”
Reviews.Author: AUSRUS
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel in the heart of Down Town LA. My friend and I decided to stay here for christmas eve and watch the LA Lakers vs Phoenix Suns play off for the turkey! The foyer, bar and restaurant are all located on the ground floor. The pool, spa and gym are located on the top floor of the hotel and presents an amazing view of the street. The room we stayed in was spacious and relaxing. This hotel is well worth the price if you want a clean stay and a good nights rest.

Reviews.Title: “For the price not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: SAWOF
Reviews.Content: Have stopped in this hotel a couple of times and has always done the job well. It not high end but neither is the price so overall good value.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: shannp
Reviews.Content: Good, but frantic service by concierge and reception (they were very busy, MJ had just died!). I had requested a twin room but was shown to a single. They couldn't help, so I had to share a kingsize bed with my 17-yr old daughter, which was OK, but not ideal. Room was fine and quiet. I had also asked for B&B, but there was only a la carte. They did say they would exclude the cost of breakfast from my bill. Overall, not great value-for-money, but it is LA! The irritating thing about Hilton is you have to pay for everything, e.g. internet access was $10 per day, why?!!! Valet parking was $40 and is essential. This hotel is well-located for concerts, etc, but not for visiting Hollywood and car travel in LA is awful. If I was forced to visit LA again, I would consider this hotel, but I really don't want to visit LA again! Go to Santa Barbara instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: arbrod13
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews of the hotels in the downtown area on TripAdvisor and comparing prices, we decided on the Hilton Checkers and I'm so glad we did. We were attending a conference at the Convention Center which is a several block walk away. If you are looking for something very close to the Convention Center, this isn’t the place, but we had bus transportation back and forth each day. My room was great! We stayed on the eighth floor and I had a nice corner room with a great view. The room had been remodeled and included a larger size flat panel TV. The bathroom was nicely redone too, the sink area was a little small but workable. My co-worker had a nice room down the hall too. I love the older feel of the hotel with the newly remodeled interior. I was worried because there were only two elevators at the hotel. But we never had to wait very long to catch one which was nice. The front desk staff, lobby, and bar staff were great. The recognized and acknowledged us each day when we returned to the hotel. The front desk staff went out of their way to make accommodations for us to stay and extra night and even were able to let us stay in the same room. She did a lot of work to be able to do that for us. We ate in the bar twice, the food and service was good. And prices weren't too bad either. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If Downtown LA is the epicenter of your trip then this is a find”
Reviews.Author: ManhattanSteves
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Checkers after first checking the reviews on Trip Advisor, which were on target. I used to live in LA, but I'm a New Yorker and wanted to spend a long weekend traveling around LA car-free. This location is great because it's near the major subway hub of Metro Center. It's also a quick walk up to Disney Hall where I had tickets to the LA Phil on Saturday night. The service was friendly and helpful. The room has the new Hilton look of minimalism and Zen natural materials. Though the window faced the street I didn't hear a thing, nor did I hear my neighbors. The first morning the hot water knob in the shower didn't work. I called Guest Services and within 10 minutes the engineer was there and the faucet was fixed. I arrived late from the East Coast so grabbed a meal at the lobby bar which serves the restaurant menu. The food lives up to the hype - very delicious and the waiter made a suggestion to change my menu choice to accommodate my vegetarian needs. The rooftop workout room was minimal provided the treadmills I needed with no competition for the machine. The bird's eye view and outdoor pool made it perfect. I would stay here again if Downtown LA is going to be home base.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: joni960
Reviews.Content: After reading several critical reviews, I was apprehensive about this hotel. But it was right next door to the office building in which I was attending a few depositions and the price was reasonable, so I decided to take a chance. I need not have been concerned. My room appeared to have been recently renovated. The furniture, fixtures and carpets all looked new and everything was very clean. I can only assume that the hotel recently renovated (I have no idea if this is true) and that some of the critical reviews here were from guests who were given rooms that had yet to be renovated. The room was fairly small, but what I’ve come to expect from hotels in major city centers. There are only two elevators and I had to wait a bit once or twice, but it was not a huge problem. The restaurant is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “the best of all the choices”
Reviews.Author: dancingvolleyballmom
Reviews.Content: since our daughter recently began school at USC, we have stayed at the Hilton Checkers 3 times in the last 6 months for various trips there. It is apparently the best of the downtown LA choices. USC recommends various hotels on their website- we have only used the Hilton because it is the only one with two queen beds in the room vs. two doubles (we are a tall family) and we are Hilton Honors members. We have been very pleased by the hotel overall - yes, the shower water is a little unpredictable temp wise (switches from hot to colder randomly), but as with all Hiltons the beds are awesome, the rooms are modern (they just put in flat screens), and the carpet was brand new in the hallways in January. Closets are huge. The lounge is very nice with dinner service available at the bar, the restaurant is fine (I wouldn't eat all my meals here, but breakfast is fine) Workout room is small but acceptable with a nice view, parking is expensive but this is downtown LA. Yes, there are only two elevators, but this was not a problem any time we were there and the hotel was sold out each night. My biggest complaint was that the bathroom counter did not have enough space for three adults' toiletries. Staff is friendly and tries hard to please. Water Grill across the street is one of the best in LA. Based on the reviews of the other hotels downtown I have read on this site, I would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nifty and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: KnowseyNomad
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my recent stay at the Hilton Checkers, on my way to catch Amtrak’s Coast Starlight to Portland. I was assigned a corner room on the 12th floor, with a pleasing view of downtown LA and the hills beyond. The room was much larger than I expected for an urban hotel, and was clean and nicely furnished, with adequate lighting. The bed was very comfortable. My schedule did not permit use of the rooftop pool or fitness center, but I did head up there at night, to check them out. The outdoor pool and whirlpool are small, but the setting is spectacular, with the city all around you, and the pools seemed clean and welcoming. I did hear the early morning leaf-blowing crew, as mentioned in a previous review, but if you are staying on a higher floor, you won’t hear more than a soft buzz, and it won’t wake you up unless you are a very light sleeper. To respond to another comment, there were adequate power outlets at my room’s desk, in the form of outlets in the base of the desk lamp, plus a power block in a nearby wall outlet. The only two negative comments I can think of are minor ones. There was a strip of small bulbs behind the bed's headboard providing indirect lighting. Nice idea, but I found it a little bright at night, and couldn’t find an easy way to turn it off without pulling the plug. Also, the elevators take a long time to arrive. There are only two, and seemed like one of them was out of service. For transit-minded folks, the hotel is an easy walk from the red line Metro stop at Pershing Square, just two stops from Union Station. I found the Metro system easy to use and quite convenient. You don’t need a car to enjoy LA! For bookish types, the hotel is also within a couple of blocks from the spectacular LA Central Library, a rare book shop whose name escapes me and wasn’t open when I was there, and a happening library-themed lounge called the Library Bar. There seemed to be plenty of restaurants in the area, but since I arrived late and left early, I was unable to sample any of them. All in all, it was a splendid and convenient stay at a nifty little hotel. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to others, though, judging by other reviews, I think I’d recommend staying on the upper floors if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: hipos
Reviews.Content: Just had a 3 night stay at this property. The staff was very friendly. The rooms were extremely nice, with great bed, bath and nice TV, etc. Parking was pricey, $38 valet, or $12-40 per day (depending on weekday, weekend) for self park without in and out privileges. Restaurant was good, but slightly expensive as would be expected. The small roof top pool area was wondeful at night. It was great to sit in the whirlpool and see all the tall buildings around. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. It was more pleasant than the Marriott, which is the only other downtown property I have tried. Showbiz ribs, just around the corner, had the best short ribs I have ever had, and we ate there 2 nights in a row!

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OZtravellerAust
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights with family of four, in December. Had early arrival from Australia (7am) and hotel allowed early check in with no problems. Room was great size in middle of city. Great service. Excellent stay. Would definitely stay again if went back to LA

Reviews.Title: “not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: andreea_g
Reviews.Content: not really a 5 star hotel. no sleepers, no minibar but it has a nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: Hans50
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Checkers is a small hotel in the middle of the LA downtown financial district If you are looking for the large-hotel experience, than keep looking. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. Our room (804) was tidy and clean, not luxurious, but nice. The photo of the top floor pool on their website is quite misleading: in reality it is not particularly well maintained, the bar was closed, and we encountered no staff up there during the week. The restaurant staff was gracious and helpful--great coffee--but the cooking was uninspired. Within a short walk, however, are many amazing places to eat, however. Parking is a hassle, because the hotel does not have a place to park, and the rates in the area was about $40 per day. MOCA is just down the street as is the Disney Concert Hall. Other museums, however, are far, far away.

Reviews.Title: “RItz-Carlton Prices; Tired 3-star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jackosan
Reviews.Content: Unless you must stay in downtown LA, there is no reason to stay at this hotel. It is old, and shows its age. There are only 2 elevators for guests. The water in the shower switches between scalding hot and freezing cold frequently and without warning. Service in the restaurant is slow (but that's OK because the food is overpriced). The "health facility" consists of a rack of dumbbells and three pieces of Cardio equipment. The pool is the size a bathtub. That said, the rooms are a decent size, as are the bathrooms, and they are clean. The staff is generally friendly, and tries to be helpful, but are not particularly well trained. Keep an eye on your bill for phantom charges.

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: RandomTraveler_8
Reviews.Content: We were in LA for a wedding and stayed here for two nights after having a simply awful experience at the Mandalay Bay in Las Vegas. This hotel is a great little hotel. It reminds me of places we've stayed in New York. The room is rather small but was perfectly acceptible for our needs. We found the bed comfortable and liked that the hotel supplied foam pillows and a non-down blanket. We found the staff very polite and helpful. We even met the hotel manager (I vbelieve his name was Eric) and he was very nice. The weekend we were there, they were filming a movie literally in front of the hotel so we got to see Chris Brown and Matt Dillon which was pretty cool. I never expected to walk into the hotel lobby and see Matt Dillon on the couch watching the Cowboys game!! Overall, a nice hotel if a little pricey, but it's in a great location. The hotel does require that you valet park since they are in the middle of the city and don't have a lot. It's not a problem, but take this cost into account if you book a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaMusafir
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay with family, the hotel is awesome, the rooms are large. The staff was wonderful and helpful. I asked for direction to the airport they printed it out and reviewed it very carefully making sure I understood. The food was great, and I love the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: talk_about_it
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel several times before and always found it a good value. We enjoy staying at smaller boutique-style hotels and there are very few options in this category in downtown Los Angeles. Our rate was very good-- $140 a night plus tax. Our room had a king-size bed, very comfortable, firm mattress with high-quality cotton bedding. The room was spacious, cool and extremely quiet. It was a slow weekend and we were given a lovely corner room -- 1003 -- with a view up Grand Avenue that included a glimpse of Disney Concert Hall, MOCA and the Cathedral. We could also see the mosaic tile rooftop of the Central Library. The hotel is within easy walking distance to all these attractions, as well as the delightful Pinot restaurant with its beguiling outdoor patio adjacent to the library. And the Biltmore with its gorgeous public spaces (and a great bar) is right across the street!

Reviews.Title: “Checkers has faded.... better alternatives in the neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Andriegel
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Gold Member. My Sister is a Hilton Diamond Member. To achieve these ranks with the Hilton affinity program, you have to stay at a LOT of Hilton Properties per year. We have both stayed at the Checkers Hilton in the past when we come to LA for business. This visit, we each paid $250 per night. I see in the other reviews the other previous guests (leisure travelers) gave good marks to this property: I am wondering if perhaps these were less seasoned travelers? As seasoned business travelers, we have come to expect more from a business hotel: THE GOOD: *Handy Location to Financial District and Staples Center *Friendly Staff at the front door *Lovely rooftop pool and patio *Spa on site THE BAD: *Filthy Carpeting- our feet turned black after a short time of going barefoot in our room. *The bathroom was filthy- it was evident that the cleaning staff does only light daily cleaning and heavy cleaning had not been done for a very, very long time. *Tile and fixtures dirty and corroded with scale and lime *NOISY: the staff at the Library next door starts the leaf (garbage) blowers at 6:45am EVERY morning in the common sidewalk betwen the buildings. When I asked the front desk clerk about this, she thought it was funny and told me there was nothing she could do. *American breakfast for two will set you back over $50.... and it's the same ingredients you get at Hilton's Embassy Suites buffet...including the nearly undrinkable coffee. The UNFORGIVABLE: *Since the property is so old, the bathroom fixtures are seperate controls. (non mixing valves) This creates a safety issues whereby it is possible for a person (especialy elderly and children) to scald themselves with hot water. When you shower, the water temp fluctuates between hot, cold, warm and then cold again. *The Television in one of our rooms was not attached to the furniture properly, and when adjusted fell off the stand and injured my associate. *No available power outlets at the desk: how is a business traveler supposed to work? *No power outlet in the bathroom: if you want to use the supplied hair dryer, you must use it in a different room other than the bathroom. *The air ducts were so visibly filled with dust, when the (weak) air conditioning is turned on, little particles of dust fly out of the duct work. CONCLUSION: This property is old and tired... no longer charming. It is in need of a major remodel. If you are going to pay this amount of money for a hotel stay, demand that you receive clean, safe, and quiet lodging. Conrad Hilton himself would be very sad and dissappointed with the lack of attention to detail at this Hilton Property.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: kfoss61
Reviews.Content: We attended a Steely Dan concert at the Nokia theatre and stayed the night at the Hilton Checkers. There were four of us in two rooms and all of us agree that everyone we came into contact with at this hotel was extremely nice. Starting with the doorman, the front desk, the maid who ran up the stairs to get us ice because our floors ice machine was out to the next morning at the restaurant where the service was impeccable. We also got room service that was prompt and flawless! I can't say enough about the service at this hotel. Very pleasant experience!

Reviews.Title: “This is a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: molletts
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for one night on June 29th. We were at the end of an 8 week holiday across the US and had stayed at some basic chain hotels so to have a little bit of luxury at the end was nice. Also we had just spent 4 days on Amtrak so of course we appreciated the Hilton. The check-in staff were very nice and our room was small but the bed was very comfortable. We had a problem with our shower and the maintenace man was there to fix it immediately. We didn't eat at the restaurant which looked a bit expensive but there is a very reasonable Yorkshire Grill just around the corner which the hotel staff were happy to direct us to. There was no problem leaving our luggage in storage for the day while we walked up to the Fashion District for some last minute shopping bargains. The walk was about 6 blocks but very interesting. We were able to use the changing facilities near the pool prior to leaving for the airport. I was surprised at the $55 taxi fare to the airport. Next time I would take a shuttle from the hotel. It is not the hotel shuttle but they could arrange one at $18 per person. A good way to end our US holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, for why we were there.”
Reviews.Author: deandesperado
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a special rate, for a family wedding. room was 805, very clean, nice confort, very small. don't know if i would pay over $150.00 for this room. Service was very good, checkin, housekeeping, valet and bellhop. all was good. bad was paying $35.00 a day for parking. area is an experience, downtown L. A.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property”
Reviews.Author: Trbear
Reviews.Content: This is a great building with attentive service, and quality food! Very comfortable beds, and just overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Gem”
Reviews.Author: jt1929
Reviews.Content: Didn't quite know what to expect from the Checkers after reading the reviews here, but we were unbelievably impressed with the hotel and especially with the treatment they gave to Diamond. + Full breakfast for two included daily for Diamond. This is a $40 value and can even be taken as room service for a small fee. The breakfasts were amazing, though healthy choices were hard to find. + Delivered chocolate-covered strawberries shortly after we arrived without prompting + Choice of Diamond amenities was nice (this is how Starwood does it and Hilton should do it more often). Choose from cookies, cheese plate, bottle of wine, etc. + Room was clean and well appointed. + Downtown location is convenient to shopping and attractions + Desk staff helpful with late-night delivery options, bag storage, late checkout, etc. + Nice, cozy bar + Rooftop pool and jacuzzi are excellent, if small + Great views from rooftop workout room - Room was a bit small, even on the top floor, but no big deal - No cocktail lounge at the top, no cocktail hour for Honors folks - Parking is outrageously expensive at $26/day. We tried to find another spot for less but ran out of time/patience. I get the feeling this place might be a bit less impressive when it's totally full, but I think it was nowhere near full on a February weekend, and the staff and property impressed us.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: FunMom702
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 4 nights for business travel. We checked out after the first night! The rooms were extremely small and they gave us a smoking room as that was the only one available. The bathroom was dirty upon arrival and the room smelled horrible. The bed was probably the worst one we have ever had at any Hilton-not the super comfy ones! The fitness facility left something to be desired. Only a few cardio machines and very musty smelling. Did not use the swimming pool, but it was located next to the fitness room, and was extremely small. We are Hilton Gold Members and they did not give us any perks. Would not recommend this hotel and will never go back!

Reviews.Title: “You could do a lot better”
Reviews.Author: firebabe
Reviews.Content: My son and I just spent one night at the Checkers, which is about all you need. I am from So. California and have been to the Checkers on two other occasions.....but, its been awhile, and boy, what a difference in the overall condition of this hotel. It's glory has long faded. Too bad really, because I really like these boutique type of hotels. We were given a room on the third floor and my first impression was that the room needed a serious makeover. Upon further inspection we found the carpets in serious need of cleaning...they were filthy and spotted, the drapes were stained and had burn holes in them. Comforter cover had snags all over it. Not long after that my 10 yr old son remarked, "what's that smell?" Well, upon looking around for the source of the odor we realized that our NON-smoking room reaked of cigarrettes from a failed attempt by the staff to mask the odor with air fresher. (the whole 2nd floor is for smokers) We moved to another room on the 8th floor which at least was cleaner, but it too needed some work. I know the building is old, but the room was stifling (this was winter time) and the air conditioner didn't work and the tub would not drain...yuck. Overall, the place needs work....half dead potted plants, pool area tired (but the view is spectacular). Well, we wanted to make the best of it and took to the streets to check out the neighborhood. There is plenty to see downtown, but you might want to avoid Pershing square as it is a major hang-out spot for the homeless and isn't much to look at anyway. Disney concert hall is great, and the Library next door is amazing and there are plenty of good restaurants within walking distance. It was fun for my son the ride the glass elevator at the Bonaventure hotel around the corner. It's in a great location for exploring Los Angeles and Hollywood, but you defintely can do better as there are tons of choices..... "L.A" is a huge and sprawling area. Oh, FYI, the valet parking in kinda steep at $26 and I found other garages in the neighborhood for a lot cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Just PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: Judy_scott_2004
Reviews.Content: What a lovely boutique hotel. My husband, Jake and I stayed November 22nd (Thanksgiving Day) and departed November 24, 2007. Our room was #803. The purpose of our visit to downtown LA was to visit our son, Jacob during the Thanksgiving holiday. Customer service was superb! From reserving the hotel room myself, conversations with "Robert" the Hotel Front Desk Manager (arranging a corner room) one week prior to arrival and meeting the Hilton Checkers staff in person - doorman, front desk, maintenance (mini-refrigerator/no charge), housekeeping, bar and restaurant staff -- just OUTSTANDING! Our son picked us up from LAX which was a 15 minute ride to the hotel (traffic was great/Thanksgiving Day). First stop, Ralph's grocery store (corner of 9th Street and Flower Street). Once we arrived at the hotel, as I stated before, the Hilton Checkers staff was very welcoming and warm. We checked in early, room was beautiful, maintained well and clean. Great view of Bunker Hill and Library Tower (tallest building/West Coast). We visited the pool and spa area -- beautiful area and views. We had our Thanksgiving Dinner at the hotel "Checkers". Perfect holiday dinner. Food, atmosphere, service and the staff was great. What a great memory for myself and my husband. The next day, my husband went to Starbucks before we went walking (downtown LA). We both felt safe and comfortable in our surroundings. I know that there is a huge amount of homeless people "wandering" but we never felt threaten, nor when approach did anyone get upset with us if we did not give out any money. To our surprise, there is quite a lot of sightseeing to behold in downtown LA. First visit, Library Tower and Bunker Hill steps. Walking further North (Hope Street) toward 1st Street, we visited "Walt Disney Concert Hall". Heading back South (Grand Ave.) visited MOCA (art museum), Water Court (water garden, shops, restaurants, next to the Omni Hotel) and had lunch at California Pizza. Once lunch was completed, we continue walking back to the Bunker Hill steps (halfway), to Citigroup Center, thereafter, to the Westin Hotel (hotel elevator to the 32nd floor to view the "Hollywood sign". Once we exited the Westin hotel onto Figueroa Street, continue South sightseeing (Macy's, etc). Ended our sightseeing at Ralph's and headed back in the late evening/dark (about a 15 minute walk) without any problems, felt safe. Had dinner at "Pete's Cafe" (corner of 4th and Main/casual). Great way to end our night with our son and his girlfriend. As my husband and I get older (42 yrs old) we prefer smaller, well-maintained hotels and esp. wonderful customer service. We had no complaints, everything was outstanding. We will be regular customers at the Hilton Checkers. judy mitchell

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: MovieGuyParadise_CA
Reviews.Content: Nice boutique hotel for a HIlton. Convenient to downtown LA. We walked back from the Nokia Theatre which is next to the Staples Center at the new LA Live about 7 blocks. Nice rooftop pool and hot tub. Rooms are a little small. Plenty of restaurants nearby and a good Irish Pub.

Reviews.Title: “Okay spot to stay for business”
Reviews.Author: cs79
Reviews.Content: The Checkers is a win-some-lose-some sort of place. The rooms are comfortable, well appointed, and tastefully decorated. The lobby is quite nice and the outside of the building from the street looks downright stately. The doorman was the friendliest guy but it pretty much ended there. The front desk people were inefficient and running around doing all sorts of things. We ate at the restaurant and, while the food was okay, it was insanely overpriced, there was really no ambiance and the wait staff were less than friendly. It felt like I was eating in someone's converted hallway and they just couldn't wait for me to leave. If you don't plan to eat there and you just need a comfortable place to lay your head (within walking distance of much of downtown and public transportation), this is a great place. But if you intend to leave your room and explore the hotel (or if you have a car and want to sight see), I'd stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected...”
Reviews.Author: Juilletdix
Reviews.Content: We unexpectedly needed a place to stay after other arrangements fell through. I made the reservation through American Express and specifically requested something in West Hollywood and this is what I got, so I was disappointed when I realized we were downtown. Check in was fast and friendly. Got a room on the top floor corner, so it had a pretty amazing view. Unfortunately, it was very loud, due to the jacuzzi that was almost exactly above our room. I was exhausted and ready to switch rooms, but the front desk told me the jacuzzi gets turned off at 10pm, so we stayed. That was true, but there was still a constant loud mechanical hum (our room was under the electrical systems closet). Other than that, the room was actually pretty nice. Good sized, nice bathroom and a comfy bed. For one night (with the help of earplugs) it more than met our needs. I wouldn't recommend the hotel dining room though. Our breakfast was very mediocre and very expensive. We didn't have time to look around for anything else before heading to LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Great Food - Personnel Mixed”
Reviews.Author: DC_Traveler88
Reviews.Content: I was staying here for business for 2 nights, and I ate in my room while doing work. They do not have wirless set up here, so be prepared to pay for ethernet. The room service food, while expensive, was very good. The lobby is tiny, and there is usually only one person working, leading to long lines. The person that was there when I checked in was great and friendly, but the person that was there the next day was unhelpful. On the second day I was there, the hotel had deactivated my room card. There is no phone on each floor, so I had to go down to the lobby to get it reactivated. There was a long line with one person working. It took a while, and there was no apology or explanation. Be warned that there is no giftshop. I had go across the street twice to the Biltmore to their gift shop so I could buy toiletries like hairspray. The breakfast service is slow. It took almost an hour from the start to end of breakfast. The room is perfectly nice and lovely, and the cleaning crew does an excellent job.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business”
Reviews.Author: GreenwichMan
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Checkers Hilton in downtown LA for three nights for business. The hotel is different than the other downtown hotels because it is much smaller and older looking. I had a corner room with king sized bed. The entire hotel is done in neutral colors -- tasteful but not boring. The room was in fine condition although the bathroom was a bit tired. The bathroom could have used a refurbishment. Service at the hotel was great, the valet was very helpful and always had my car on time. Room service was also very good -- the food was restaurant quality and served exactly when I requested. The flat screen and entertainment system worked properly, no technical kinks. Same with the high speed internet access. Although the hotel doesn't have the bar scene of the Standard, it was great for a business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This Place Is Like a 3 Star Hotel Past It's Prime”
Reviews.Author: SlipRat
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the feel of entering the "Twilight Zone". It may be priced right, but it isn't what I would expect from a four star hotel. We booked two rooms. Called ahead to get them together or at least on the same floor. They could not Guarantee they could do it. Well, they couldn't. We have 5 kids so my wife and I split the kids up and had to sleep in seperate rooms. The curb outside the hotel was full, so I pulled into what I hope was the garage. Luckily the first night we were there, we got stopped by a valet/bellman. The same guy who helped us from the car brought our luggage up. I had the feeling there couldn't be more than 5 people working at the hotel and everyone had double duties. The second night, we had to hunt someone down to take the car, and even then, they seemed bothered. The bar is seperated by a curtain. The pool looks big on the website, but we thought it was the jacuzzi, until we saw the even smaller jacuzzi just past the pool. The hotel staff said the rooftop had a great view. Ummmmm..... The view was obstructed by all of the newer, more modern hotels and high rises. So I guess it could be a good view, if you enjoy the voyerism of looking into the surrounding hotel and office windows. The headboard had a thick layer of dust on them. The airconditioner dripped water. Their was no good way to keep the shower at a comfortable temperature. In both of our rooms it had only two, cold and scalding. We found that if we went upstairs and showered in the spa area, we could make the shower temperature work better. The bedding was nice, but there was only two pillows on the bed. The hotel is centerally located in LA, which makes it close to many attractions. This hotel is more adult orientated. I would not reccommend this hotel for families.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at the Hilton Checkers!”
Reviews.Author: jenjaxn
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. From the minute we arrived there, it was a wonderful experience. The staff was friendly and courteous. We checked in quickly with a decent rate (116.00/night) Our room was beautiful. We had just come from a horrible night at the local Nite Inn so we were happy to see a room that was clean and tastefully decorated. The room was quiet and there were plenty of towels and Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries in the bathroom. We had a king size bed, flat screen tv and a gorgeous bathroom with a super high shower head which my tall husband appreciated. The hotel has 24 hour room service which we loved! We ordered some cookies late night and made coffee in our room. We also had a great room service breakfast the next morning. The food was just delicious! They have internet there but it's not wireless and you need to pay. The only way the stay could have been better is if they had wireless internet access. We had a great nights sleep and would definitely stay at the Hilton Checkers again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Quiet”
Reviews.Author: kirk20003
Reviews.Content: I stayed over one-night on a weekday for business arriving around 9PM departing next day. I chose to park my car myself in the next door garage skipping the valet. Where the Valet has a rate of $26/night .. I payed $32/night. OK, not a smart idea. Check in was quick .. the room very nice. I liked the intimate bar and ordered room service in the morning .. very nice, expected high price and got it. I think the hotel is great find for business people not wanting a huge hotel. I will stay again pending the rate I got of $120/night.

Reviews.Title: “Unfit for fitness”
Reviews.Author: GaerielSky
Reviews.Content: The room I stayed in was very nicely appointed and clean. Fine location for those traveling for business (LA Mart). HOWEVER, here are a few caveats: There is no minibar. I personally don't use them, except to store water & soda purchased elsewhere but a friend needs one to store medication and you have to pay extra each night for a room with a minibar. The pool looks really nice in the hotel photos, doesn't it? Well, it must have been taken with a special camera lens because the pool is really the size of a large tub. It's about 10 ft long. If you push off the "far" end you will reach the other side in about 2 seconds without the need to actually swim. So, if you want to sunbathe, you're in luck. If you want to swim, look elsewhere. While I was there they even left a letter in guestrooms saying that they were closing the pool for a private function on the terrace, which was fine by me since I couldn't use the pool for exercise. However, when I next saw the "closed" pool, they had put a, I kid you not, rug over it and taped the edges. All I could picture was someone at a company fuction walking over it and falling in - like a cartoon character. And my last comment... the "fitness room." HAHAA! There is one elliptical, 2 treadmills, and an archaic stairmaster and bike. On top of that, there were always about 10 people wanting to work out, so there was a line. And the room wasn't air conditioned properly so that you were working out in about 80 degree heat.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK; Downtown a disaster”
Reviews.Author: theWimp
Reviews.Content: When I read reviews in here that are all over the map, it makes me want to check out a hotel myself. I usually stay on the westside in LA and decided this was the time to try downtown. Well, the hotel is great for sleeping and such, but if you are looking for a grand experience, go somewhere else. The hotel has no lobby or public area as such, and the restaurant is only for high end dining. The $ 26 valet charge is too high for me, so i walked the block with my rollabout and paid $ 5 for the Friday night I stayed. You can actually use the same garage the hotel parks your car in a lot cheaper, but there is no in and out. The rooms, or the room i was in, was way above average. The A/C was cold, the water was hot and it was very quiet. The pool area was closed the night I was there but it looked pretty inviting if you like tall buildings all around you. If you are just looking for a good night's rest, then the hotel is very nice. Downtown LA is very disappointing. I like sightseeing, and have been to most of the attractions downtown. But I took my late afternoon walk and when you go 3 blocks away from the hotel, towards Broadway, it borders on scary. Definitely not for children. You are better off staying on the westside and driving to the downtown attractions. Sorry LA, I love you as a city, but downtown still has a way to go as a destination. But if I had to go back, I would pay the extra money and stay in the Biltmore across the street just for the lobby and common areas which are beautiful and very historic. Note to Hilton Honors members. No preferential treatment here, for you info. I was not even acknowledged as a member.

Reviews.Title: “Four Star... Yeah Right”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Checker from April 24-30th and the Checker's restaurant was totally awesome. The food was great. The interior features of the hotel was very nice and neat. However, the guestrooms had stains on the carpet, the bathroom had a urine stench and housekeeping did not do a good job in cleaning our guestroom. Everything was done half-hazardly. In addition, the ice maker was broken and after notifying the front desk about it, they asked me what I wanted them to do about it. Imagine that! I said, "how about sending somone up to fix it". They sent someone to my room with a pail full of ice. How disgusting! I was surprised being that this was a so called 4 star hotel- maybe it was due to the restaurant's reputation only.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal at Checkers”
Reviews.Author: DeepJ
Reviews.Content: My family booked the Checkers for our family vacation on Priceline[--] and paid 75.00 a night! Dowtown is easy access to everything and the hotel was excellent. The staff was courteous and helpful and the bellmen were outstanding. The rooms were good size and the beds extremely comfortable. The pool and hot tub were rarely used by anyone so we had the facility almost always to ourselves! Plus the view from the room was excellent. I differ from Froemmer's concerning the restaurant, I did not care for it, overpriced and poor service. Their are other places to eat close by and we enjoyed those. Considering the price and the facilities I would recommend the Hilton Checkers to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Poor excuse of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stu.bec
Reviews.Content: Firstly be advised there is no parking only valet at $26 per night. After first checking i was surprised at how small the hotel was but it was nicely decorated. The room was tiny and some of the fittings in the bathroom were falling off the walls. The view was nice but i knew instantly this was going to be a dreadful stay. I came back the next night and after a very long day found i had been locked out of my room. I went to the front desk and was told i had been locked out until i had paid the cost of the calls made from the telephone, it was a total of $140 which was approx 5 mins worth of calls to the UK. Not only that but i was trying to be charged for about 8 calls which i hadnt actually made. After an age explaining that i couldnt possibly have made 3 calls all to the same number all at the same time i was let back into my room. The next evening i went for a meal in the hotel restaurant, the food was beautiful. When my bill came approx $100 i left a $20 tip. It was only when i returned to the UK that i found the waitress had taken $100 for the meal $20 for the tip and a further $30 in gratuity. When i checked in i was asked to leave $150 in case i broke anything - something i have never done in any hotel in the whole world. When i checked out the gave me the $150 back in $1 notes. The pool is nice however. To call this hotel a Hilton is an insult to the Hilton name. Stay far clear of this hotel there are plenty of other 4 stars near by.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Checkers; a Dreadful Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In December of 2005, we were booked into the Hilton Checkers Hotel in Los Angeles. Everything in this report is absolutely true and has not been exaggerated. We can see why our travel agent thought the hotel would be terrific. After we got home, we went to the hotel website and saw what she must have seen when she looked at it. The place looks gorgeous on the website. The actual hotel, however, is quite different from what is on the website. The exterior views on the website don't show the ground and the sidewalk outside the hotel. This is because there are drunks and vagrants sitting or sleeping on the sidewalk. The photo of the hotel lobby has been shot with a wide-angle lens to make the actual small, narrow room appear larger. The lobby shot has also been Photo Shopped to make it appear bright and well lighted and to make the marble floor look highly polished. The actual lobby is dark and dreary and has a marble floor that is dull and scuffed. There is even a cheap burgundy colored curtain on one side of the lobby to close off the bar, which is on the other side of the curtain. Is it perhaps against the law to be serving alcohol in a room where there will be children? This might account for the curtain. The mirror in the lobby that looks so bright and well polished is actually in need of having the back re-silvered and the frame is chipped and in need of a paint job. Most of the other photos on the website appear to have been shot with a wide-angle lens, too. If the lobby photo is any indication, the meeting rooms, bar, swimming pool, and restaurant probably don't look like the photos either. The room that we were given was dark, dreary, and not clean. Some time or other (probably not recently) someone had tried to dust the place. This was done with some sort of less than clean damp cloth. The streaks from the cloth were on all of the glass surfaces in the bedroom and bathroom. A film of dust was covering the streaks. The bathroom floor was downright dirty, as was the tub. The linens on the bed had seen better days. The curtains were absolutely filthy, with repulsive looking stains on them. There were also smudges of some sort of black colored stuff on the curtains. The furniture in the room was shabby and consisted of mismatched pieces. The desk chair was particularly old and cheap. Again, all of this differs radically from what is shown of the rooms on the hotel's website. The suite shown on the website looks lovely...and perhaps this suite actually exists at the hotel. Of course, it may have been Photo Shopped, too. The old, worn carpet in our room had stains on it. We wouldn't have wanted to walk on either the carpet or the bathroom floor in our bare feet. The dust in our room was terrible. I have allergies to dust and mold, so I was having trouble breathing within a couple of minutes after entering the room. Even my friend who was with me, who has no allergies, was having trouble breathing after we had been in there awhile. I'm sure that, even though we never ventured up to the rooftop bar, it doesn't look anything like the photo on the website either. The Checkers really has presented an incredibly false impression of the hotel on the website. We called our travel agent from our room and told her what was going on. She found us a room at the downtown Marriott and we left the Checkers less than an hour after we checked in. Our travel agent also called the Checkers and told the desk clerk that we were checking out and why. We left less than an hour after we got there. At least we weren't charged any money. We loved the downtown Marriott, on Figueroa Street, and stay there all the time now when we go to Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: trekkrsal
Reviews.Content: Hilton Checkers is an unimposing hotel with a terrific location. My husband and I spent a weekend there, and found it not lacking in anything. The service (both front desk and doormen)were pleasant and helpful. The room was immaculatly clean... better than I have seen in more expensive hotels. All ammenities were as listed (Evelyn and Crabtree), had a hair dryer, coffee maker, iron, etc. The beds were the most comfortable I have ever slept in, in a hotel. We wanted a late check out, which they happily granted us. We did not go to the rooftop pool, as we walked to the Bonaventure Hotel instead (about one block) and had a cocktail on the top floor revolving lounge and restaurant,(takes about 60 minutes for the full 360 degrees) with a beautiful view of the city. Also at the Bonaventure there are nearly two full floors of various restaurants, from quick Thai or Morrocan food to sit down Italian restaurants. The Los Angeles Public Library is next door to Checkers, and is well worth a visit. The "Dash" public bus takes you to the Fashion District (aka, Garmet District), and many other places, all for only 25 cents! The hotel is only a block from the jewelry district. Also, if travelling by train, the hotel is only a block from the Pershing Square exit on the Red Line. All in all, it was a pleasurable experience, and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Way too small for a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: lite2shine
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights and I was surprised that this hotel is a four star hotel. The lobby is very tiny and so was the room. The bathroom was pretty decent size and I liked it. The service was fine. I didn't feel it's a special place at all. Surprisingly they had a gov rate so I stayed there for $108/day (and I needed to stay in downtown) otherwise I wouldn't have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: wings76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there on a Friday of the Thanksgiving weekend. This was our second visit, the first about a month prior in October. In our first visit we were pleased with the service. Our $129 a night room was a bit small but the bathroom was spacious and the bed was VERY comfy. When we found out they charge $26 bucks a day for parking our jaws dropped a bit. But I guess that's L.A. prices for you. I found the bar intimate and the server friendly. On our second visit over Thanksgiving, $129 per night got us a bigger room this time but a smaller bathroom. This room had carpet dirt spots in the entry way. The staff wasn't as friendly has the first visit but they were still helpful in time of need. The room service was timely and the food was ok. I was dissapointed as with the 1st visit that the bar up on the roof was not open to serve us drinks, so we simply took our own drinks up there to enjoy the view. I would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Room!!”
Reviews.Author: KristenJovi
Reviews.Content: This was the first of 3 hotels that my friend at I stayed in during our recent / first trip to California. While shopping around for good deals and a nice place to stay, I had noticed that people are way more likely to write negative reviews than they are to point out the positives. So I knew that regardless of the quality of my stay in CA, I was going to review each hotel once I got back. That being said, we really enjoyed our stay here. We got there a few hours before check in time but the staff was very accomodating and they were able to let us check in early. Our bags were promptly brought up to our room and we were very pleased with all aspects of the room. The beds were probably more comfortable than in any other hotel that I've ever stayed in. The room was spotless and everything was in working order. We ordered room service one night and the food was excellent. There was a billing error with our bill for the food, but it was promptly corrected. My only major complaint would be the location, which has nothing to do with the quality of the hotel. The hotel is located in downtown LA, in the financial district. So if you happen to be there on a weekend, as we were, don't expect to find anything open nearby. We walked several miles hoping to find a restaurant, shop, or really just anything that was open, with no luck. And as with any downtown area, the homeless population was extensive. But still, we felt very safe once inside the hotel. Also, the hotel has a chauffered car service who they use, which really came in handy getting to the airport, for not much more money than a cab. I would defintiely recommend this hotel, as long as you have activities/plans of things to do outside the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Probably not top-rate enough for Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was the day before our end-of-summer trip to Los Angeles, and I still had no idea where we would be staying. So, I decided Priceline was the way to go. Each bid request kept bringing back rejections, so I kept upping the ante and adding $5 to my nightly rate plus adding a new location. Finally, the magic words appeared: "Your bid has been accepted!" Hilton Checkers, Downtown Los Angeles. Whoops! Did I really check yes to downtown L.A.? Well, I had. So, visions of a 4-star hotel on the beach quickly disappeared. What we did get was a 4-star hotel with 4-star service, albeit a few wrinkles. Details are below. Parking: Beware the parking charge: 26 bucks a day with unlimited in-and-out privileges. Yes, the unlimited in-and-out is nice, but of course we felt obligated to tip each time. So, by the end of our four-night stay, we had shelled out $120-plus in parking. Also, how long it took to get the car was very inconsistent. Sometimes, it only took a couple of minutes. Other times, we waited close to 20 minutes.There are parking lots nearby, but most do not have in-and-out privileges, and most of the safe-looking ones were close to $20 a day. The room: Spacious. When we checked in, the man at the desk was very accommodating and did his best to find us a larger, corner room when he saw our very active toddler in tow. The room was also very clean. One morning when we returned after breakfast, we surprised the maid, who was on her hands and knees scrubbing the tub. I was pretty impressed. That night, I felt none of the trepidation I usually have venturing into hotel tubs. The bathroom was spacious and a great place to make phone calls while our 18-month-old took her naps in the room. The room also had high-speed Internet access for about $10 a day. It was very easy to connect and seemed noticeably faster than my home DSL connection. (There is also a free Internet terminal in the hotel's lobby for guests to use.) One thing that was missing was a mini fridge. When I had inquired about them on the phone before our arrival, I was told that I could request a room with one when we arrived. No one mentioned that there would be a $10 a day charge and that it would have to be delivered. It would have been a nice touch for keeping our daughter's milk chilled. The pool and fitness room: This is the reason why I gave the hotel above average reviews rather than excellent. A summer family vacation in Los Angeles inevitably includes time poolside, and we were excited for that until we saw the rooftop pool. The view was nice, but the pool itself feels like an extended hot tub. It is tiny by four star hotel standards, even by motel standards. It was fine when we were the only ones using it, but add a few more people in, and it quickly became decidedly crowded. The hot tub is nice and has a great view. You can order drinks and/or snacks from room service, and they will be delivered there. One other problem with the pool is that the roof is also used for hotel functions at which point a wooden platform is placed over the pool and it becomes inaccessible to guests. One afternoon we arrived at the pool only to find it covered up. What happened next made me feel much better. I inquired at the front desk as to when it would reopen. After a few minutes on hold, I was told that we could go use the pool across the street at the Millennium Biltmore Hotel without any charge. This turned out to be a stroke of luck. The pool there is tiled from the 1920s and worth a visit. It is also much larger than the pool at the Hilton, so everyone was happy, especially my daughter, who didn't need sunblock, since the pool is indoors. On the night we arrived at Checkers, there was a welcome happy hour poolside. Free appetizers were passed around, and you could order drinks. A screwdriver and a glass of wine came to about 20 bucks. My husband was very happy with the fitness room as there was a LifeFitness eliptical machine in it. Fresh water and towels were also available. The neighborhood: The good part of it is that there are lots of historical buildings to tour (the Bradbury Building would have to be the highlight) and lots of Monday through Friday cafes. L.A.'s impressive library is literally next door. The bad part is that the place becomes a virtual ghost town on weekends. To get milk for my daughter on a Sunday morning, I had to drive to Little Tokyo, 10 minutes away. I combed the streets surrounding the hotel, but nothing was open. Even RiteAid didn't open until 10 AM. All in all, the Hilton Checkers is a great place to stay if you want to be downtown, comfortable, and don't care about the size of the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Checkers is a very nice place to stay in the downtown LA. The room is very large and very clean. The service is good. I realy enjoy may stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms vary tremendously.. and not in a good way”
Reviews.Author: baycyd
Reviews.Content: Several of us stayed here ... all paid same rate, but each had a different size room... a couple adequate rooms, 3 others had rooms the size of closets (less than a foot from end of bed to armoire with TV). No hair dryers in the b/rooms. Beds nice and comfy, but carpeting was quite dirty. Pool a joke -- and closed for private party 1 night and just closed the other. Barely enough room to turn around in lobby. Would never stay here again...!
